cutie package¶

Submodules¶

cutie.model module¶

class cutie.model.Cutie(EMBEDDING_SIZE: int, GRID_SIZE: int, N_CLASS: int, BATCH_SIZE: int, EMBEDDING_FUN: Callable)¶

Bases: torch.nn.modules.module.Module

Pytorch implementation of Cutie model https://arxiv.org/pdf/1903.12363.pdf

count_parameters()¶
forward(x)¶

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

initialize_weights()¶
learn(optimizer, criterion, epoch, train_loader, device, log_interval=10)¶
predict(json_file, device)¶
training: bool¶
validate(criterion, val_loader, device)¶

cutie.utils module¶

Bases: Generic[torch.utils.data.dataset.T_co]

Dataset class for cutie model training

Bases: torch.nn.modules.module.Module

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

cutie.utils.init_stats(N_class: int) → dict¶

Initialize a dictionary to store cutie model training or validation statistics

Parameters

N_class (int) – Number of classes to predict

Returns

dictionary to store the statistics

Return type

dict

cutie.utils.save_scores(scores: dict, stats: dict, dataloader: Callable, N_class: int)¶

Calculates and saves the scores after each epoch during cutie training

Parameters

  • scores (dict) – Dictionnary storing the training or validation scores

  • stats (dict) – Dictionnary storing the training or validation statistics

  • dataloader (torch.tensor) – Dataloader function used to train or validate the model

  • N_class (int) – Number of classes to predict

cutie.utils.save_stats(stats: dict, N_class: int, output: None._VariableFunctionsClass.tensor, target: None._VariableFunctionsClass.tensor, loss: None._VariableFunctionsClass.tensor)¶

Calculates and saves the statistics after each batch during cutie training or validation.

Parameters

  • stats (dict) – Dictionnary storing the training or validation statistics

  • N_class (int) – Number of classes to predict

  • output (torch.tensor) – output predictions of the model

  • target (torch.tensor) – Ground truth classes

  • loss (torch.tensor) – Loss calculated on the current batch

class cutie.utils.word2vec_embedding(vocab, embedding_size)¶

Bases: object

Word2vec embedding class for cutie model training experimentation

embed(text)¶
cutie.utils.write_scores(scores: dict, epoch: int, N_class: int, file_path: str)¶

Append the scores to a csv file after each epoch during cutie training

Parameters

  • scores (dict) – Dictionnary storing the training or validation scores

  • epoch (int) – Current epoch of the training

  • N_class (int) – Number of classes to predict

  • file_path (str) – Path to the output file
